description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. Written in several scripts (see record of each individual text). Some of the texts have been collated (see collation note on fol. 16a). Foliation in pencil using Western numerals (upper cover is fol. 1; this record follows the existing foliation). Graffitis and inscriptions on the covers. Inscription "52" in Arabic numerals on fol. 2 and lower cover. The only text dated is Qirāʼat Warsh, dated 741 (or 751?) H.
author: Ibn al-Firkāḥ, Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, 1262-1329
abstract: Collection of texts on religious matters.
contents: 6. fol. 41a-50b: Qirāʼat Warsh / Muḥammad ibn Shuraysh al-Ruʻaynī.
title: Fawāʼid min kalām Burhān al-Dīn al-Fazārī. Qaṣīdah fī madḥ al-nabī ... [etc.].
provenance: Ownership statements on fol. 2a, 17b, 19a, 29a, 39b, 40a, 41a (dated 1026 and 1033 H.), 50b. Audition statements (samāʻ) on fol. 29a, 39a-b and 40b. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: Ibn al-Firkāḥ, Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, 1262-1329
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
